intro: Tragacantha oxyrhyncha, commonly known as the Persian gum tree, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and woody, thorny stems. The plant produces a valuable gum, tragacanth, which is used in various industrial and medicinal applications. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along riverbanks. Tragacantha oxyrhyncha is also known for its adaptability to harsh climatic conditions.
